to the outside of the work so that you can find it later to weave it in slip first stitch to needle 1 slip second stitch to needle 2 slip third stitch to needle 1 slip fourth stitch to needle 2 continue in this fashion until needles 1 and 2 both have 8 stitches begin working in the round by knitting stitches on needle 1 then stitches on needle 2 you may wish to distribute the stitches to more needles for ease of continuing to work in the round for solid strap work in stockinette knitting all stitches for 22 inches 56 cm or to desired length of strap for striped strap work in stockinette with color b for one inch 2 5 cm when adding color a ensure that your yarn end is on the outside of the work so that it accessible for weaving in round 1 knit one round in color a round 2 knit one round in color b continue those two rounds until strap is 21 inches 53 cm or one inch 2 5 cm shorter than desired length work round 2 only for one inch 2 5 cm close strap arrange stitches evenly on two needles knit together one stitch from the front needle and one stitch from the back needle until all stitches have been worked and you are left with 8 stitches attach strap with a spare needle pick up 8 stitches from the purl row on the bottom edge of the bag make sure that strap is not twisted perform a three needle bind off as follows knit together one stitch from the strap with one picked up stitch knit together the next stitch from mantra mat bag page 2 of 3 shelby knits the strap with the next picked up stitch pass the first knit stitch over the second continue in this fashion until all stitches are bound off break yarn drawstring work i-cord as follows with color b cast on 4 stitches do not turn *slide stitches to the other end of the left needle working yarn will be on the left side of the work at this point knit 4 * repeat between * until cord measures 32 inches 81 cm or to desired length bind off all stitches break yarn finishing weave in ends thread
